Recap: Jeffrey tells Cassie and Josh that Doris Wolfe, the DA, has assigned him Jonathan's case to prosecute. Josh tells Jeffrey that he doesn't think it is a good idea to be around Cassie. Later, Josh kisses Cassie on the forehead and she gets flustered. Alan-Michael tells Dinah that he will get his revenge against her. At his apartment, Alan-Michael speaks to someone asking him/her if the assignment has been taken care of.

Mallet finds another threatening note which reads: "Paybacks a bitch." Dinah has trouble with the brakes and as Mallet tries to tell her how to handle the car, she wrecks. She is just shaken after the accident and Mallet finds fluid on the street. Alan-Michael makes another secret phone call and asks if the job is done.

Reva undergoes a chemo treatment and hears Cassie outside her room, looking for her. Colin flirts with Cassie and protects Reva. Reva finally asks how much time she has and Colin tells her he doesn't know. Cassie brings Reva to a room for her surprise from Josh. Josh looks at Reva and she cannot believe she is standing in the cabin of Cross Creek, in Springfield. Josh tells her that he would move heaven and earth for her and wants to grow old with her here in her new old home. As she looks at the mantel which reads: Reva  Josh  Always  Forever, she sobs and tells Josh, "Never let go".
Transcript: Reva: Jonathan, it's me, again. Look, I'm just calling to see if you've thought about all of this. Have you talked to Lizzie yet? It's your baby, too, you know, sweetie, and there's some things you just can't avoid. Call me. (Sighs ) Some things that you just can't avoid. ( Sighs ) Oh, I'm... ( laughs )
Buzz: Wow, gee, hi. I hope he's worth it.
Reva: Uh, who?
Buzz: The guy you're willing to run me over for.
Reva: Oh... ( laughs )
Buzz: I like the do, the hairdo. It's nice.
Reva: Oh! Oh, yeah. Uh, change of life moment.
Buzz: Okay. It's one of those days, huh?
Reva: Yeah, well, it's one of those lifetimes.
Buzz: Okay. Look, I won't ask, but... I can't ignore a friend who needs a boost.
Reva: And what kind of boost did you have in mind, Buzz Cooper?
Buzz: Come with me, Reva.
Reva: ( Laughs )
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cassie: Okay, thanks.
Josh: Was that about our surprise, by any chance?
Cassie: Your surprise. Reva's surprise. But yes.
Josh: Mm-hmm.
Cassie: And it turns out everything is right on schedule.
Josh: That's a good thing, because that gives us some time to concentrate on the important things in life, like gossip.
Cassie: Oh.
Josh: ( Laughs )
Cassie: Wow, I may be selfish, but I'm just glad it's not my baby having a baby.
Josh: What, you're not excited about the idea of Jonathan and Tammy procreating?
Cassie: ( Fake laugh ) Not even funny. Thank you. I am trying with those two. I really am. But he does not make it easy.
Josh: What now?
Cassie: I had to ask them to leave.
Josh: Dare I ask why?
Cassie: Broke the house rule, the only house rule-- or at least the only one that mattered, for that matter. I don't know. If it hadn't been that, it would have been something else.
Jeffrey: Hi, Josh.
Josh: Hi.
Jeffrey: Cassie.
Cassie: Jeffrey? Hi.
Jeffrey: Sorry if I'm interrupting something. Tammy called me and, well, she asked me to help Jonathan with his pending legal issues.
Josh: Huh.
Cassie: She did?
Josh: Yeah, that's funny, because I told her not to call you.
Jeffrey: Oh, why's that?
Josh: Well, I just... don't think Cassie needs to be around you right now.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alan-Michael: Just come right out with it, Dinah. "Don't fire me, Harley, please. Bosses get stabbed in the back every day. Friends betray their best friends all the time. You can trust me."
Dinah: Harley and I are fine. We're fine. You just want to see two girls go at it, don't you?
Alan-Michael: ( Laughs ) Maybe. Put my money on you, though.
Dinah: Me, too. But there's going to be no fight because Harley knows that I'm on her side again.
Alan-Michael: Wow. You actually said that with a straight face.
Dinah: I know, 'cause it's the truth. Alan-Michael, why don't you just give it up? Spaulding Enterprises is being run by people who actually care about the future.
Alan-Michael: A family business should stay in the family. Why is that so hard to understand? It's good business.
Dinah: Is that what we're doing here, "good business"?

Alan-Michael: Absolutely. But getting even with you... well, that's personal, Dinah. Don't think I'll forget what you've done. And when I do take my revenge-- and I will-- I intend to enjoy every minute.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Mallet: Good. Come on in. I want to ask something. So you handle on the deliveries here, right? 9-to-5 room service, mail, right? So, how did this get into my room? Did you leave it in my room?
Bellhop: No.
Mallet: Okay, well, if you didn't leave it here, I already know housekeeping didn't. How did this get here if you didn't leave it?
Bellhop: Honestly, Detective, it wasn't me.
Mallet: Right. Okay. Thanks. Oh, Fred, here. Sorry. Thanks.
Bellhop: Thanks a lot. Oh, I almost forgot. Miss Marler's dry cleaning got dropped off.
Mallet: Oh, yeah, the little black number with the slit up to... never mind. Thank you for that.
Bellhop: No, thank you.

Mallet: That's a weird- looking receipt. Hey, Fred, sorry. Got a few more questions. Where did this dry cleaning come from? I mean, how long was it in the lobby? Did anybody have access to it where it was stored?
Bellhop: Look, my manager told me to deliver it when you called. That's all.
Mallet: That's all you know?
Bellhop: That's it.
Mallet: ( Sighs ) Okay. Okay, Dinah. Who the heck is after you?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dinah: Are you threatening me?
Alan-Michael: No threats, just promises. You'll be very sorry you didn't stick with me. I promise.
Dinah: Is this where you twirl your evil mustache and let out a nice laugh?
Alan-Michael: You tell me. Hey.
Marina: Hey. What's going on here?
Alan-Michael: Two old friends just getting a couple of things straight, that's all.
Marina: Really. That all it is?
Alan-Michael: It's business, Marina.
Marina: As in none of mine.
Alan-Michael: If you want us to have any kind of relationship, you need to stay out of this part of my life.
Dinah: Are you crazy enough to think that this beautiful girl would even be interested in you again after what you did to her aunt?
Alan-Michael: My dealings with Harley are strictly business. Marina and I... well, that's something completely different.
Dinah: ( Whispering ) This is where you put him in his place.
Alan-Michael: If she really feels that there's no future for us, then maybe she should return one or two of the gifts I've sent.
Dinah: Oh, he gave you gifts. What a surprise.
Marina: Flowers. But they died. Makes them hard to return.
Alan-Michael: And the pearls, don't forget. They looked so perfect dangling that way from the orchids.

Dinah: Okay, before I puke, I think you should slither your way into somebody else's life, 'cause you're not going to get the company, and you're definitely not going to get the girl. I'm going to make sure of that.
Alan-Michael: Now who's threatening who, Dinah? Marina, I'm pretty sure I'm not the only one who felt how good it could be between us, how good it was.
Dinah: He's an arrogant jerk. And unfortunately, he's planning to do something with Spaulding. I don't know what it is, but I have to figure it out fast.
Marina: You know, Dinah, I think I might know just the thing to help you out.
Dinah: Oh, no. No, no, no, no. Your father would kill me if he found out I was pushing you towards Alan-Michael again.
Marina: Hey, who's pushing? No one's pushing anybody here. This is... this is all me. You need someone on the inside, and if I could get him to think that I want him back...
Dinah: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. Do you want him back?
Marina: I just want to help.

Dinah: Look, Marina, we'll talk about this later, all right? But let me tell you something: He's a very dangerous guy, and you need to stay clear of that, okay? I don't want anymore drama between me and your family.
Marina: Hello? You're not listening to me here, okay? This is all me. It's all my decision. I can take care of myself.
Dinah: All right, look, we'll talk later. Okay? Okay.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jeffrey: So you think Cassie would be better off staying away from me, hmm? And you just decided that on your own?
Josh: ( Laughs ) I just think you guys need a little space from each other.
Cassie: Okay, okay, okay, Josh, I think I'll... I can handle this.
Jeffrey: Yeah, that's a good idea.
Cassie: I'm sorry, I... I wouldn't have called you. I don't... don't think it's fair to ask you to help.
Jeffrey: Okay. Well, you know what? It doesn't matter, because I'm not sure how much help I can be. See, the D.A., the new D.A., has put me in charge of Jonathan's case.
Cassie: So you're going to prosecute Jonathan's case?

Jeffrey: Well, she's assigned me to it, and I don't see that there's any way out of it. And between you and me, she does have a hell of a case against him-- with her own underage daughter as the primary witness. So somebody needs to talk to Jonathan and get him to take a deal while he still can. But you didn't hear that from me. Oh, and next time I need to talk to you, maybe I'll just go straight to your personal answering machine, okay?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: It's really beautiful. I love it.
Buzz: Oh, I can tell.
Reva: ( Laughs ) I just... I got caught off guard.
Buzz: Ava did it for Liz and Coop's baby. The things people do for love.
Reva: Coop and Ava?
Buzz: Oh, nothing's going to come of it, you know. They're both being very grown up and unselfish.
Reva: Ah. Like us, huh?
Buzz: ( Laughs ) Exactly. I'm not... I'm not crazy about the idea of Coop being connected to Lizzie for the rest of his life, but, you know, I'm kind of sappy about this... this new baby thing.
Reva: Yeah, well, I understand that.
Buzz: I kind of like this grandfather thing. You know, it's the lower expectations, I think. I think I'm good at it.
Reva: Oh, you are good at it. I mean, you were always Susan's favorite.
Buzz: Girls like me.
Reva: I like you, too. So you ever think these things come around for a reason?
Buzz: You think Lizzie and Coop belong together?

Reva: No, no. I'm not talking about that. I just mean... you know, you're going along and your life just happens, and then something comes around and knocks you flat. You think someone's trying to tell you something.
Buzz: If so, I must have done something pretty good along the way, because here I am, still around to greet the newest member of the family. So it doesn't get much better than that.
Reva: Not much.
Buzz: You know what this makes me think of? Two years ago, me lying flat on the floor, hanging on by a thread.
Reva: Oh, your heart attack.
Buzz: Yeah. Just... just to be here, to appreciate all this stuff, you know?
Reva: I do know. It's a beautiful room. Thanks, Buzz.
Buzz: I hope you're going someplace fun.
Reva: ( Laughs ) Yeah, well... no, it's... it's... it's great. And the baby's going to love it. I can still make it.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cassie: I can't believe that Jeffrey is going to prosecute Jonathan's case.

Josh: Well, I'm just hoping he can move it along, that's all. I miss my wife. You know, I'm having the time of my life working on this veteran's project. I want her by my side, but I can't really compete with Jonathan.
Cassie: I'm sure you'll have her all wrapped up just as soon as you reveal your little surprise.
Josh: My little surprise, yes. I think if I don't tell her soon, my head's going to explode.
Cassie: Oh, don't do that. Messy.
Josh: Yes, it will be. Hey!
Reva: Hi, everyone!
Josh: There you are, my beautiful wife! Full of surprises. I like the hair.
Reva: Oh, thanks. Just trying to keep things interesting.
Josh: Where did you come from?
Reva: Upstairs with Buzz.
Josh: Ah.
Cassie: I won't ask if you don't.
Josh: No, that's fine, as long as you left some time for me, because... I got plans for you later-- for us, actually. Big plans.
Reva: ( Laughs )
Josh: Let's go!
Reva: Whoa, cowboy!
Josh: What?
Reva: What about the little cowgirl?
Josh: She'll be fine. Come on.
Reva: No. You know what? I'll just meet you later, because I have an... an errand.
Josh: Are you playing hard to get?
Reva: I might be. How's it working for ya? Does this surprise have something to do with this project of yours?
Josh: Yes and no. What about what you're doing? Does that have something to do with Jonathan, by any chance?
Reva: Yeah, what else? So I'd better go.
Josh: You should know Jeffrey is going to be prosecuting Jonathan's case.
Reva: Oh. That's good, I think.
Josh: Actually, he didn't sound too optimistic.
Reva: Yeah, well, Jonathan's in over his head this time. That's why he needs my help.
Josh: Okay. Is there anything that I can do?
Reva: Nothing. You've already got enough on your plate as it is.
Josh: ( Sighs ) It's just that once we get past this Jonathan debacle, I'll have you back, and my life will be perfect.
Reva: You deserve that. More than anyone else. And I owe you so much. So as soon as I'm done with whatever it is I'm going to do, I'm all yours.
Josh: Okay. Just... don't get lost.
Reva: I won't.
Josh: Okay.
Reva: The sooner I get finished with this, the sooner I get my surprise.
Josh: ( Laughs )
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alan-Michael: So, that little assignment I asked you to take care of? Where do things stand? Really? That's good. Very good.
[SCENE_BREAK]
( Cell phone ringing )
Dinah: Hey, you!
Mallet: Where are you?
Dinah: Well, I'm on my way. I've just got one more stop and then I'm headed home.
Mallet: Humor me, would you? Just forget the quick stop and come back to the Beacon.
Dinah: Why?
Mallet: Because I'll fill you in when you get here. Please? Just come home. I'm not kidding. I want you here now.
Dinah: Honey, stop worrying about... wait a minute, what's going on here?
Mallet: What? What's happening?
Dinah: I mean, I... I'm pumping the brakes and nothing's happening. It's like they're not working.
Mallet: What do you mean, won't work?
Dinah: I mean I can't slow down! I don't know how to stop!
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cassie: Would you just take a hike? Go! Whatever Reva was doing, I'm sure she's done by now. Go meet her.
Josh: Are you trying to get rid of me?
Cassie: I am trying to help you.
Josh: Well, that's a good thing, because I need you. I need you to find my wife for me and make sure she gets there on time.
Cassie: How am I going to do that?
Josh: I don't know, but I'm sure you will.
Cassie: You know what, Josh, I would really rather not.
Josh: But you're going to anyway. Thank you.
Cassie: ( Sighs )
Josh: Go. Are you okay?
Cassie: I... I'm fine. I'm going to go... I'm going to go find her. I'll see you later.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: Isn't this nice and cozy? Two of us sitting in the same room together, not saying a word to each other?
Colin: What?
Reva: There you have it.
Colin: Oh, that was fast. Thank you so much, Kristi.
Kristi: Anytime, Doctor. Hi, Mrs. Lewis.
Reva: Hi, Kristi.
Kristi: Hey, good luck on your speech. And if you'd like to join us afterward...
Colin: Oh, thanks, but...
Kristi: Okay. Well, if you change your mind, we'll be at J. Farley's.
Reva: She's cute, and I am so right.
Colin: ( Chuckles ) Aren't you always?
Reva: She has a major crush on you, and you're not interested?
Colin: No.
Reva: Oh, come on, Doc. You're new in town. Don't you want to connect with someone, have a life?
Colin: No time.

Reva: Careful. Because one day you could be hooked up to one of these things, and you're going to be wishing you'd made the time. I took my life for granted, too, you know. I fell off the face of the earth any number of times and put my family through hell. But I always came back. Yeah, I still wasted a lot of time, and I want it back. I want that time back.
Colin: That's impossible. Just make use of the time you have.
Reva: How much time is that?
Colin: I don't know. If I knew, I would tell you.
Reva: Yeah.
Cassie: Excuse me, hi. I'm Cassie Winslow. I think we've met before. I'm here looking for my sister, Reva Lewis. Have you seen her, by any chance?
Reva: Oh, my God. She can't find me here.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Rob Bogue, "Inside The Light". What's Ricky Paul Golden really like? "Guiding Light" would be a big concrete room, and he would be like a 180-pound superball. First of all, I want to give a shout-out to the crew. Mallet's love for Harley and Mallet's love for Dinah, they're... you know, I guess you'd have to say he's in love with two women. I wanted to be a cowboy. I became an actor because I really couldn't get a job doing anything else. See Mallet Wednesday, June 7, "Inside The Light."
[SCENE_BREAK]
Colin: I'll take care of this, Kristi. Thank you again for your help with the speech. And I will see you later, right? At... at Farley's?
Kristi: Yeah. Okay.
Colin: She's a nice girl, but she's having kind of a tough day. ( Laughs ) I'm Dr. McCabe, Colin McCabe.
Cassie: Hi, I'm Cassie Winslow. Hi.
Colin: Well, it's nice to meet you, miss? Mrs.?
Cassie: Mm, yeah, neither. ( Laughs ) How about just Cassie?
Colin: All right, Cassie. Well, what brings you to Cedars today? You look very healthy.
Cassie: Thank you. I'm actually just here looking for my sister, Reva Lewis.
Colin: Oh, do you have a room number?
Cassie: Oh, no, she's not in a room. In fact, I just stopped by because we've been working on this project, and she's had some meetings here lately, so I thought I'd take a chance.
Colin: Well, I'm on my way down to the cafeteria. Why don't you walk with me, and we'll take a look around.
Cassie: Oh, that's very nice. I don't think that would be necessary, though. She's probably not even here. I just... you know, I just took a shot.
Colin: Yeah, well, that's what I did. I just took a shot in coming out here. I heard that voice and figured I had to come out and see the face that went along with it.
Cassie: That's very sweet. Well, I need to go find her, so I'm... I'm going to go. Thank you for your concern. I'll see you around.
Colin: Done. She's gone.
Reva: You are a very bad boy.
Colin: Hey, I thought you wanted me to get rid of your sister?
Reva: "I heard your voice and thought I should just see the face that went along with it". ( Laughs )
Colin: I did what I had to do.
Reva: You know, you're a big old flirt when you want to be. But thank you. You saved me.
Colin: Well, that's my job.
Reva: Don't you forget it. Cassie's probably gone by now, and I'd really like to get out of here, too.
Colin: Well, I will try to get you finished up so you're out of here before anyone else comes looking for you.
Reva: I'm just so darn popular, you know?
Colin: ( Chuckles )
Reva: Enough about me, though. Let's talk about you. That was a speech you had to make, right? You have to make it in front of a bunch of medical mucky... muckety-mucks, mucks, mucks, right?
Colin: ( Laughs )
Reva: So why don't you rehearse it? You read it to me, and I'll give you notes.
Colin: I don't think so.

Reva: Oh, come on. I'm pretty good at it. I had to make a speech myself not too long ago, and I was scared to death. But I'll tell you something-- when it was done, it was such an empowering experience.
Colin: You're almost done with your I.V. You'd walk out in the middle of my speech, and I'd be traumatized.
Reva: Oh, yeah. I would walk out, probably-- run out, actually, because I do want to talk to my son.
Colin: You're very worried about him, aren't you? Jonathan, right?
Reva: I'm worried about all my kids, at any given time, but Jonathan is actually the most like me.
Colin: Oh.
Reva: And now he's about to be a father, and that is the best and worst thing that could possibly happen to him.
Colin: That's right. Your son's going to be a father.
Reva: That doesn't mean you can call me grandma!
Colin: ( Laughs ) Well, I wouldn't. You're not my grandmother.
Reva: Right.
Colin: You don't seem like the type that would take to being a grandmother.

Reva: Well, you'd be wrong. I was very young when I had my own kids, and it's only fitting that I should be young to welcome in the next generation. Some people aren't lucky enough to watch their kids grow up, or their kids' kids... be able to hold that little baby. That wonderful smell. Having my own kids was always marred by some drama or trauma, and now this new little baby? It's a whole new beginning. And that's what I want.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ashlee: Mr. O'Neill.
Jeffrey: Oh, hello, Ashlee. Did your mom send you?
Ashlee: No. Why?
Jeffrey: Well, she should be here any minute.
Ashlee: Oh, really? I... I had no idea, I... when I saw you, I just thought that... may I ask you a question?
Jeffrey: Sure, fire away.
Ashlee: Do I have to testify at Jonathan's hearing tomorrow?

Jeffrey: Ashlee, the whole case is based on your testimony. Didn't your mother go through this with you? You're going to tell the judge that Jonathan's bar served you alcohol and that Jonathan got you drunk at the prom.
Ashlee: If I do that, he'll never speak to me again.
Jeffrey: What?
Ashlee: It's just... I've never met anyone like him before.
Jeffrey: No, I'm sure you haven't. Listen, Ashlee, you made a statement. The whole case is based on that statement.
Ashlee: ( Whispers ) Yeah.
Jeffrey: Were you telling the truth?
Ashlee: Mr. O'Neill, I think I made a horrible mistake.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Alan-Michael: If you can take care of that for me, I'll be very grateful. And when I'm grateful, I'm generous. Right. As long as no one connects me to... you got it. ( Knocking at door ) Hey, check back with me later. Yeah. Hi.
Marina: Hi. Why don't you seem surprised to see me?
Alan-Michael: Call it confidence. You want to come in?
Marina: No, thanks. I, uh... I just came by to return these.
Alan-Michael: Oh. Well, I'm sorry about...
Marina: I'm sorry, too. And I... I can't wear these. They're too heavy. But I was hoping that you... you might have something a little lighter?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dinah: Mallet, the brakes were working just fine a minute ago.
Mallet: Okay, listen to me. Just try and stay on the road, okay?
Dinah: Mallet, what's happening?
Mallet: Where are you? Where are you right now?
Dinah: I am on highway 10, on the north side of town. Right where the road meets the hills.
Mallet: What's happening now?
Dinah: Now... oh, my God! I can't! Do you know what comes after the hills?
Mallet: Uh, yeah. The road curves into that industrial park.
Dinah: Yeah, there are too many turns, there are too many turns. I'm not going to make it. I'm going too fast.
Mallet: Okay, look around. Tell me what you see. What's out the left, what's out the right?
Dinah: A wall!
Mallet: Where?
Dinah: On the right!

Mallet: This is what you're going to do, you're going to aim for it, okay? You're going to jerk your wheel hard to the right, and then back left at the last second, okay? You're going to... you're going to hit it broadside with the car.
Dinah: I don't think I can do it, Mallet. No!
Mallet: Do it! Do it now, Dinah! Do it!
Dinah: Mallet! ( Tires screeching )
Mallet: Dinah? Dinah!
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alan-Michael: So, you just stopped by to return the earrings?
Marina: Exchange them.
Alan-Michael: Right.
Marina: You want to know the truth?
Alan-Michael: Give it a shot.
Marina: You're slime.
Alan-Michael: Thank you.
Marina: You asked. Let's see, you lied to me, you used me, you betrayed my Aunt Harley.
Alan-Michael: I know, I know. I stole candy from baby pandas. I'm evil and heartless.

Marina: You're a lot of things. I realized something today, when Dinah was trying to protect me earlier. I kept hearing this little voice in the back of my head, and it kept saying, "Dinah, stay out of this. This is my business. And if I want to tell him to stay the hell out of my life, then I will do it. I don't need any help, because it's my life. It's my choice." And... ( sighs )
Alan-Michael: And what?

Marina: And if I want to tell you that I cried the day that these came, then... then I will, because it's my life, and it's my choice, and... and I can say whatever I want to whoever I want whenever I want, and...
Alan-Michael: You cried?
Marina: Maybe a little.
Alan-Michael: Look, why don't you have a seat?
Marina: No, I... I don't even... I don't know what you want, I don't even... I don't know what you...
Alan-Michael: What I...
Marina: What you expect. From me. God, I don't even know what I expect from myself.
Alan-Michael: Listen, I...
Marina: No, I... I should just go. I shouldn't be here.
Alan-Michael: Wait, wait, wait. It's your life, right? Your choice. Don't let anyone tell you how you... what you should do, how you should feel. Don't... Marina.
Marina: Gold ones would be nice.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Mallet: Dinah? Dinah. Dinah.
Dinah: Hi.

Mallet: Are you all right? Thank God, you're all right. Come on, let's get you out of here. Okay, come on, nice and easy. Easy, I got you. It's all right. You're going to be fine. Come this way. I got you.
Dinah: ( Groans )
Mallet: Are you okay? How's your head? How do you feel?
Dinah: I feel like I crashed the car.
Mallet: Toes, arms? Here, sit here. Arms, legs, toes broken? Anything? How's your head?
Dinah: Oh, just shook up, that's all.
Mallet: Yeah? You sure?
Dinah: Yeah. You had the car all week. You didn't feel anything?
Mallet: No, no. The brakes were fine.
Dinah: I just... I kept pumping, and nothing happened. That car wouldn't stop. I tried everything I could.
Mallet: That's okay. It's not your fault. Just close your eyes, okay? Catch your breath. Everything's going to be all right.
Dinah: What are you doing? What is that?
Mallet: Nothing. Nothing. Let's go. Let's get out of here. Come on.
Dinah: Honey, I think we should call the police and make a report, don't you?
Mallet: I am the police. I'll call the police and I'll call in the accident and get a tow truck. Let's get out of here. You okay?
Dinah: ( Groans )
Mallet: It's all going to be okay.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cassie: Reva! There you are.
Reva: Hi, sis.
Cassie: Well, this is crazy. I was just here and didn't see you.
Reva: Yeah, I just came from upstairs.
Cassie: Oh. Visiting someone, or you had a meeting?
Reva: Visiting. Yeah, visiting a friend who I used to work with.
Cassie: Well, then that is just perfect timing because, Reva, there is something you need to see.
Reva: Really?
Cassie: Mm-hmm.

Cassie: Or it could be right down the street. Come on, come on.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Doris: Jeffrey, sorry I'm late. What are you doing here?
Ashlee: Window shopping.
Jeffrey: Ashley wants to discuss her testimony.
Doris: What about it, sweetie?
Ashlee: I... I'm just nervous, I guess.
Doris: I understand. You just need to tell the court the truth, and nothing but. Right, Jeffrey?
Jeffrey: Absolutely. The truth. And what is the truth exactly, Ashlee?
Ashlee: Jonathan got me drunk. Twice.
Doris: Good girl. Why don't you go check out those brown shoes over there? They'll be perfect for court. What's wrong, Jeffrey?
Jeffrey: I think we need to float Jonathan Randall a deal.
Doris: ( Scoffs ) No deals. That kid is a menace. I want him nailed to the courtroom wall.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ashlee: Lizzie. Hi, it's Ashlee. I need your help, and you really need mine, so... so you'd better call me back, like yesterday.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: Cassie. This is freaking me out, really.
Cassie: ( Laughs )
Reva: I mean, I am too tired, and... and I just... I... I'm just not in the mood for surprises.
Cassie: Are you sure about that?
Reva: Yes!
Cassie: Oh, stop. Stop right there. You're sure? Not even this one?
Reva: What?
Josh: How you doing, darlin'?
Reva: This isn't real. It's... it's just not... I mean, this isn't... it's not... it's not possible. I mean, I'm not in Oklahoma!
Cassie: You're right about that, Dorothy. ( Giggles )
Josh: Welcome home, Rev. I mean, welcome to your new old home here in Springfield.
Reva: Joshua, what's going on?

Josh: Well, here's the thing. The house would have gotten in the way of the project in Oklahoma. So, in order to follow H.B.'s plans the way that he drew them, we would have had to tear down the cabin.
Reva: So you moved it?
Josh: Yeah.
Reva: Cross Creek? It's here?
Josh: Yeah.
Reva: ( Laughs )
Josh: We've always... we've always said that time stands still here in this place, that things are healed in this place, that we would grow old together here. So now... what's stopping us?
Reva: ( Crying ) Nothing. Nothing is. Nothing ever will. ( Laughs )
[SCENE_BREAK]
Marina: Honey, I'm home!
Buzz: Yes, you are. You hungry?
Marina: Oh, no thanks.
Buzz: How'd things go tonight? You have a good night?
Marina: It was okay. Just some loose ends I had to tie up.
Buzz: Loose ends? Alan-Michael's back?
Marina: That's what I hear.
Buzz: That's what you hear? That's what you... you know...
Marina: Oh, will you please put the meat cleaver away.
Buzz: If I hear...
Marina: I don't want to have to arrest my own grandfather!
Buzz: If I hear you-know-who is back giving trouble to Harley, I'm go... is he after the company, still?
Marina: I think that there's a lot of things that he's after.
Buzz: Oh.
Marina: It's just whether he gets them or not. We'll just have to see about that.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alan-Michael: Yeah, hi, it's me. So did you get the job done? Good answer. What? No. Nothing else I need from you. Hey, is England's still the best jeweler in town?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dinah: Honey, I'm fine. I'm fine, really.
Mallet: You will be. I had to help you all the way, though, okay? So just let me take care of you tonight, all right? Just for tonight do me that little favor.
Dinah: Okay, I will do you that favor, okay? And I will do anything you want me to.
Mallet: All right, so why don't you start by filling me in on what you were doing right before the accident.
Dinah: What does that have to do with anything?
Mallet: I'm... I'm testing your memory, make sure you haven't had a concussion, okay? So, why don't you tell me, what were you doing before you got in the car?
Dinah: Honey, I had a normal day! I had a normal day. I went out, I did some... made some errands, you know, and had an argument with somebody.
Mallet: You had an argument with who? Who was it?
Dinah: Honey, I'm fine. I'm fine, really. I'm okay. I'm fine.
Mallet: Okay, all right. I'll get you some ice.
Dinah: Why are you so snappy today?
Mallet: Because you could have got hurt tonight.
Dinah: I know that, I know that. But it was an accident. It was an accident. It was a freak accident, and these things happen to people all the time.
Mallet: Yeah. Yeah, yeah, you know, you're right. I guess you're right.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Josh: So? Tell me what you really think.
Reva: What I think? I... I can't. Because I'm dizzy and I'm all jumbled up inside, and I'm... so happy and so grateful to you. Oh, Bud.
Josh: Yep, there it is, where it's always been and where it always will be. ( Chuckles ) Hey. Ooh. Whoa, you okay? ( Laughs )
Reva: Yeah, yeah, yeah. You always did make me weak in the knees, Joshua Lewis.
Josh: Reva, I would move heaven and earth for you. So moving a house, hey, that was easy.
Reva: Oh, I can't believe you did this. Yeah, right. It was not easy.

Josh: Okay, you're right. It was not easy. But you have to remember something-- you're married to a man who does not give up, especially on something this important. You do whatever you have to do. You... you fight, if that's what you have to do. You make it work. You hang on, and you never let go.
Reva: Never let go. Never, never let go.
[NEXT_ON]
Harley: I thought you were clean. I'm leaving you, and I'm taking the kids.
Ashlee: You'll do it, or I'll tell your boyfriend how I forged those pregnancy records at my clinic.
Jonathan: This baby will ruin my life. It's Coop's baby as far as I'm concerned. That's the way Lizzie wants it, that's the way it's going to be.
